intro: Nassauvia pumila, commonly known as the smoothleaf nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing, mat-forming shrub that typically reaches heights of less than 10 inches. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. Its flowers are pale blue to purple and bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping.
